title: Smartwater Quality Test Report
description: Breaking down what's inside Smartwater and how it affects your health, with a water quality test report.

body.raw: ## Smartwater Overview **Oasis score:** 71 / 100 **Owner and Manufacturer**: Coca-Cola Company. **Treatment process**: vapor distillation process which attempts to replicate nature's hydrologic cycle. The vapor-distilled water then undergoes a proprietary filtration process. **Source**: Most facilities obtain the water from municipal water systems. A Few get the water from protected groundwater sources with approvals from local authorities **pH level**: 9.5 **Flouride level**: 0.0 ppm ## Smartwater Ingredients - Calcium Chloride: - Magnesium Chloride - Potassium Bicarbonate - Electrolytes **Effects of Calcium Chloride** Calcium chloride (CaCl2), commonly found in water, dissociates into calcium and chloride ions when consumed. These ions are independently regulated in the body and contribute to various physiological functions. It's essential to understand the impact of calcium chloride on human health in the context of drinking water consumption. Benefits of Calcium Chloride - **Calcium Contribution**: Calcium is vital for bone and teeth formation and maintenance. It plays a crucial role in blood coagulation, neuromuscular activity, enzyme activity, and acid-base balance. - **Chloride Contribution**: Chloride maintains osmotic and acid-base balance in the body, predominantly existing in extracellular fluids. Harms of Calcium Chloride - **Low Acute Toxicity**: Calcium chloride demonstrates low acute toxicity in oral exposure, but high doses can lead to adverse effects. - **Gastrointestinal Irritation**: In some animal studies, high doses have led to severe ulceration and perforation of the stomach. - **Skin and Eye Irritation**: Exposure to anhydrous calcium chloride can severely irritate the eyes and cause skin lesions in case of repeated contact with concentrated solutions. - **Respiratory Irritation**: While the reliability of certain studies is questioned, some evidence suggests that calcium chloride can cause slight respiratory irritation. Interactions and Safety - **Dissociation in Water**: When consumed in drinking water, calcium chloride dissociates into calcium and chloride ions, which are absorbed efficiently and regulated separately. - **Safety in Low Concentrations**: In consumer products like cosmetics, calcium chloride in aqueous solutions poses a low risk of eye irritation, suggesting that at low concentrations, it might not present significant health risks. Calcium chloride, when consumed in drinking water, contributes essential calcium and chloride ions for various body functions. While it shows low acute toxicity, high concentrations can lead to gastrointestinal, skin, and eye irritation. It's crucial to monitor the concentration levels in drinking water to harness its benefits while mitigating potential harms. _Sources_: [PubMed: Calcium Chloride in Drinking Water](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9827598/), [EWG: Calcium Chloride](https://www.ewg.org/guides/substances/895-CALCIUMCHLORIDE/), [Industrial Chemicals: Calcium Chloride Human Health Assessment](https://www.industrialchemicals.gov.au/sites/default/files/Calcium%20chloride%20%28CaCl2%29_Human%20health%20tier%20II%20assessment.pdf) Effects of Magnesium Chloride **Magnesium Chloride** Magnesium Chloride, a blend of magnesium and chloride, is not just a mere ingredient but a conduit to enhanced health when present in drinking water. Benefits - **Essential for Bodily Functions**: Magnesium is pivotal for muscle and nerve function, regulating blood sugar and blood pressure, and is involved in the synthesis of protein, bones, and DNA. - **Promotes Bone Health**: A key player in bone formation, maintaining optimal magnesium levels is crucial for bone density and overall skeletal integrity. - **Regulates Blood Pressure**: Studies indicate that magnesium can have a modest effect in managing blood pressure, a boon for those grappling with hypertension. - **Diabetes Management**: Magnesium plays a role in managing blood sugar levels, potentially benefiting individuals with type 2 diabetes by improving insulin sensitivity. - **Migraine Relief**: Evidence suggests that magnesium can be an effective agent in preventing migraines, offering relief to those suffering from this debilitating condition. - **Sleep and Mood Enhancement**: Adequate magnesium levels are associated with better sleep quality and mood regulation, contributing to overall well-being. Harms - **Digestive Upsets**: Excessive intake can lead to gastrointestinal issues like stomach upset, nausea, and diarrhea. - **Rare but Serious Risks**: In extreme cases, too much magnesium can cause more severe symptoms like hypotension, dizziness, and confusion. - **Interactions with Medications**: Magnesium can interact with various medications, necessitating consultation with healthcare providers for those on medication regimes. - **Individual Variability**: Effects can vary greatly depending on individual health conditions and dietary habits. In essence, while Magnesium Chloride in drinking water can be a health ally, its consumption must be balanced and tailored to individual needs. The key is moderation and awareness of one’s own health profile. _Sources:_ [Magnesium Consumer](https://ods.od.nih.gov/factsheets/Magnesium-Consumer/), [Hypertension](https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/10.1161/HYPERTENSIONAHA.116.07664), [Nature](https://www.nature.com/articles/ejcn20124), [Verywell Health](https://www.verywellhealth.com/magnesium-chloride-4768643#citation-17), [MDPI](https://www.mdpi.com/2072-6643/12/7/2104), [RxList](https://www.rxlist.com/magnesium_chloride/generic-drug.htm) **Potassium Bicarbonate** Potassium Bicarbonate is more than just a component of drinking water; it's a key player in our overall well-being. This alkaline mineral is crucial for various bodily functions, from keeping our hearts beating strong to ensuring our muscles work seamlessly. It's like the unsung hero of the mineral world, quietly making a significant impact on our health. But, as with all things, moderation is key. Here's a breakdown of its benefits and considerations: Benefits of Potassium Bicarbonate: - **Heart Health Maverick:** This mineral is a boon for our hearts. It not only keeps the heartbeat in check but also supports muscular contractions, essential for a healthy cardiovascular system. High potassium intake, coupled with low salt, can be a game-changer for blood pressure management. - **Guardian of Bones:** Here's a fact that might surprise you - Potassium Bicarbonate is a bone health champion. It fights off calcium loss, thereby keeping bones robust and sturdy, particularly crucial as we age. - **Muscle Functionality:** Ever wondered what helps your muscles contract and avoid cramps? Potassium Bicarbonate is the answer. It's vital for maintaining muscle strength and functionality. - **Kidney Stone Dissolver:** Struggling with kidney stones? Potassium Bicarbonate might come to your rescue by dissolving those pesky stones formed by uric acid. - **Potassium Level Balancer:** For those moments when your body is running low on potassium due to health issues, this mineral can help bring things back to equilibrium. Important Considerations: - **Hyperkalemia Hazard:** More isn't always better. Too much Potassium Bicarbonate can lead to hyperkalemia, which is as dangerous as it sounds, with symptoms like dizziness and even cardiac arrest. - **Medication Interactions:** If you're on medication, especially for blood pressure or kidney issues, a chat with your healthcare provider before embracing this supplement is a must. - **Not for Everyone:** Certain health conditions like kidney disease or Addison's disease? Pregnant or nursing? It's best to steer clear of Potassium Bicarbonate or seek medical advice first. - **Dosage Matters:** Remember, even a good thing can be harmful in excess. Stick to the recommended dosage to reap the benefits without the risks. In essence, Potassium Bicarbonate is a potent ally for our health, but it demands respect and careful usage. It's a perfect example of how balance and moderation are key to harnessing the benefits of nature's offerings. _Sources_: [Source 1](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2630872/), [Source 2](https://www.accessdata.fda.gov/scripts/cdrh/cfdocs/cfcfr/CFRSearch.cfm?fr=184.1613), [Source 3](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4817273/pdf/nihms769011.pdf), [Source 4](https://www.ahajournals.org/doi/10.1161/hypertensionaha.109.147488), [Source 5](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28073209/), [Source 6](https://www.healthline.com/health/potassium-bicarbonate#takeaway) ## Smartwater Full Testing Report A 2018 sample water quality analysis for smartwater is listed below. Please note that in the results column of each table “ND” indicates Non-Detected. **Residual Disinfectants** | Standard of Quality (mg/L) | Results (mg/L) | | -------------------------- | -------------- | | Chloramine (4) | ND | | Chlorine (4) | ND | | Chlorine Dioxide (0.8) | ND | **Radionuclides** | Standard of Quality (pCi/L) | Results (pCi/L) | | ---------------------------------- | --------------- | | Gross Alpha particle activity (15) | ND | | Gross Beta particle (50) | ND | | Radium 226 (3) | ND | | Radium 228 (5) | ND | | Uranium (0.03 mg/L) | ND | **Microbiological** | Standard of Quality | Results | | ------------------------ | ----------------------------------- | | Coliform (< 4 CFU/100mL) | Absent (Membrane Filtration Method) | **Physical Quality** | Standard of Quality | Results | | ------------------- | ------- | | Color (15 Units) | Pass | | Odor (3) | Pass | | Turbidity (5 Units) | Pass | **Organic Components** | Standard of Quality (mg/L) | Results (mg/L) | | ---------------------------- | -------------- | | Aluminum (0.2) | ND | | Antimony (0.006) | ND | | Arsenic (0.01) | ND | | Barium (2) | ND | | Beryllium (0.004) | ND | | Cadmium (0.005) | ND | | Chloride (250) | Pass | | Chromium (0.1) | ND | | Copper (1) | ND | | Cyanide (0.2) | ND | | Fluoride (1.4 – 2.4) | ND | | Iron (0.3) | ND | | Lead (0.005) | ND | | Manganese (0.05) | ND | | Mercury (0.002) | ND | | Nitrate (as N) (10) | Pass | | Nitrite (as N) (1) | ND | | Phenols (0.001) | ND | | Selenium (0.05) | ND | | Silver (0.1) | ND | | Sulfate (250) | ND | | Thallium (0.002) | ND | | Total Dissolved Solids (500) | Pass | ## Smartwater Oasis Page [See full report](https://www.oasis.ai/blog/smartwater_quality_reportt) ## Sources [Water Report](https://article.images.consumerreports.org/image/upload/prod/pdf/cq_water_reports/SmartWater_2018.pdf)
